meanings.definition: A ticket stub given to a customer when a sold-out item is purchased, allowing them to purchase the item at a later date.
meanings.sent1: I got a raincheck for the concert tickets, so I can buy them next week.
meanings.sent2: She received a raincheck for the movie tickets that were sold out.
meanings.sent3: The raincheck for the event made her smile as she knew she could still attend.
meanings.sent4: The raincheck was like a promise of future fun waiting to be redeemed.
meanings.sent5: The raincheck fluttered in her hand, a reminder of the upcoming show.

meanings.definition: To postpone an invitation or offer to a later time.
meanings.sent1: Can we raincheck our dinner plans to next weekend instead?
meanings.sent2: He had to raincheck the meeting due to unexpected circumstances.
meanings.sent3: She decided to raincheck the shopping trip and stay home instead.
meanings.sent4: Rainchecking the job interview was a tough decision, but necessary.
meanings.sent5: I will raincheck the gym session and go for a walk in the park instead.
